title: John Chapter 9 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on John chapter 9 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: John Chapter 9 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of John Chapter 9.

questions.question: Who was blind from birth according to John 9?
questions.correctAnswer: A man Jesus saw
questions.explanation: John 9:1 states that Jesus saw a man who was blind from his birth.

questions.question: What question did the disciples ask Jesus about the man's blindness?
options: Did the man or his parents sin?
questions.correctAnswer: Did the man or his parents sin?
questions.explanation: John 9:2 records the disciples asking if the man or his parents sinned to cause his blindness.

questions.question: According to Jesus, why was the man born blind?
options: To show the works of God
questions.correctAnswer: To show the works of God
questions.explanation: Jesus said the man was not blind due to sin but so that God's works could be displayed (John 9:3).

questions.question: What did Jesus create to heal the blind man's eyes?
questions.correctAnswer: Clay made from spittle
questions.explanation: Jesus spat on the ground, made clay from the spittle, and anointed the blind man's eyes (John 9:6).

questions.question: Where did Jesus tell the man to go wash his eyes?
questions.correctAnswer: The pool of Siloam
questions.explanation: Jesus instructed the man to wash in the pool of Siloam to receive his sight (John 9:7).

questions.question: What was the reaction of the neighbors when the blind man could see?
options: They questioned if it was the same man
They reported him to the Pharisees
questions.correctAnswer: They questioned if it was the same man
questions.explanation: Neighbors wondered if the man who could see was the same one who had been blind (John 9:8-9).

questions.question: On what day did Jesus heal the man?
questions.correctAnswer: The Sabbath
questions.explanation: John 9:14 states that Jesus made the clay and healed the man on the Sabbath day.

questions.question: What was the Pharisees' reaction to Jesus healing on the Sabbath?
options: Some said Jesus was not from God
questions.correctAnswer: Some said Jesus was not from God
questions.explanation: Some Pharisees said Jesus was not from God because he did not keep the Sabbath (John 9:16).

questions.question: What did the healed man say about Jesus when asked who healed him?
questions.correctAnswer: He is a prophet
questions.explanation: The man answered that Jesus was a prophet (John 9:17).

questions.question: Why were the man's parents afraid to speak about Jesus?
options: Because the Jews agreed to put out anyone confessing Christ
Because they did not believe in Jesus
Because they did not know Jesus
questions.correctAnswer: Because the Jews agreed to put out anyone confessing Christ
questions.explanation: John 9:22 explains the parents feared Jews who agreed to expel anyone confessing Christ.

questions.question: True or False: The man who was healed denied that Jesus had opened his eyes.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: The healed man clearly testified that Jesus opened his eyes (John 9:25).

questions.question: True or False: The Pharisees accepted that Jesus was from God because of the miracle.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: The Pharisees were divided and some rejected Jesus despite the miracle (John 9:16, 9:29).

questions.question: True or False: Jesus said He came into the world to bring judgment so that the blind might see and the seeing might become blind.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Jesus stated this purpose clearly in John 9:39.

questions.question: Complete the verse: 'He said unto him, Go, wash in the pool of ______.'
questions.correctAnswer: Siloam
questions.explanation: Jesus told the man to wash in the pool of Siloam to receive sight (John 9:7).

questions.question: Complete the verse: 'If ye were ______, ye should have no sin: but now ye say, We see; therefore your sin remaineth.'
questions.correctAnswer: blind
questions.explanation: Jesus said this to the Pharisees, highlighting their spiritual blindness (John 9:41).

medium.title: John Chapter 9 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from John Chapter 9 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with understanding suffering. Based on John 9, what biblical truth would you share about the cause of suffering?
options: Suffering is always a result of personal sin.
Suffering is never connected to sin.
Suffering can be used by God to reveal His works.
Suffering is punishment for the sins of ancestors.
questions.correctAnswer: Suffering can be used by God to reveal His works.
questions.explanation: Jesus explains that the man's blindness was not due to sin by him or his parents but so that the works of God might be displayed (John 9:2-3). This teaches us that suffering can have a divine purpose beyond human fault.

questions.question: How does John 9 teach about obedience in following Jesus' instructions even when they seem unusual?
options: The man ignored Jesus' instructions and was healed.
The man obeyed Jesus to wash in the pool and received sight.
The man asked for proof before obeying Jesus.
The man healed himself without Jesus' help.
questions.correctAnswer: The man obeyed Jesus to wash in the pool and received sight.
questions.explanation: Despite the unusual instruction to wash in the pool of Siloam, the blind man obeyed, and as a result, he received his sight (John 9:6-7). This shows the importance of trust and obedience to Jesus.

questions.question: A fellow believer feels isolated after receiving a spiritual blessing. How does John 9 encourage us to respond to opposition when standing for the truth?
options: Avoid sharing your testimony to prevent conflict.
Deny the truth to keep peace with others.
Confidently testify to what God has done despite opposition.
Blame others for their lack of faith.
questions.correctAnswer: Confidently testify to what God has done despite opposition.
questions.explanation: The man boldly testifies about Jesus healing him, even when the Pharisees reject and cast him out (John 9:25, 9:34). This teaches perseverance and courage in witnessing.

questions.question: How does John 9 illustrate humility and reliance on God's power rather than human wisdom?
options: The healed man claimed credit for his healing.
The Pharisees accepted the miracle as God's work.
The healed man acknowledged he did not know if Jesus was a sinner but trusted God’s work.
The healed man refused to answer questions.
questions.correctAnswer: The healed man acknowledged he did not know if Jesus was a sinner but trusted God’s work.
questions.explanation: When questioned, the man says he does not know whether Jesus is a sinner but knows he was blind and now sees (John 9:25). This shows humility and faith in God's power beyond human judgment.

questions.question: How does John 9 teach about the importance of personal testimony in evangelism?
options: Only religious leaders should share the gospel.
Personal experience of God's work is a powerful witness.
Arguments and debates are more effective than testimony.
questions.correctAnswer: Personal experience of God's work is a powerful witness.
questions.explanation: The healed man shares his story repeatedly to the Pharisees and others, emphasizing the transformation God worked in him (John 9:10-11, 9:26-27). This highlights testimony as a key tool in evangelism.

questions.question: What does John 9 teach about the relationship between spiritual sight and true faith?
options: Spiritual blindness is a condition even among those who claim to see.
Faith is not related to spiritual perception.
Only religious leaders have spiritual sight.
questions.correctAnswer: Spiritual blindness is a condition even among those who claim to see.
questions.explanation: Jesus states that some who claim to see are spiritually blind, as in the Pharisees’ case, highlighting that true faith is more than physical sight (John 9:39-41).

questions.question: How does John 9 encourage believers to trust God’s timing and work diligently?
options: Work only when it is convenient.
Delay obedience until circumstances are perfect.
Jesus emphasizes working while it is day, because night comes when no one can work.
Rest and inactivity are preferred over work.
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus emphasizes working while it is day, because night comes when no one can work.
questions.explanation: Jesus teaches the importance of doing God’s work in the right time, urging diligence and faithfulness (John 9:4).

questions.question: How does John 9 emphasize the importance of faith in Jesus as the Son of God?
options: Faith is irrelevant to receiving spiritual sight.
Belief in Jesus as the Son of God leads to worship and salvation.
Jesus denies being the Son of God.
The healed man rejects Jesus’ identity.
questions.correctAnswer: Belief in Jesus as the Son of God leads to worship and salvation.
questions.explanation: The healed man confesses his belief in Jesus as the Son of God and worships Him (John 9:35-38), showing the vital role of faith in Jesus.

questions.question: True or False: According to John 9, Jesus healed the man on the Sabbath, causing controversy among the Pharisees.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Jesus healed the blind man on the Sabbath, which led to dispute among the Pharisees about whether Jesus was from God (John 9:14, 9:16).

questions.question: True or False: The healed man's parents fully understood and supported how Jesus had healed their son, openly sharing this with the Pharisees.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: The parents acknowledged their son was blind but said they did not know how he was healed because they feared the Jews (John 9:20-22).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Jesus said, "I am the ______ of the world" while healing the blind man.
questions.correctAnswer: light
questions.explanation: Jesus identifies Himself as the light of the world, emphasizing His role in bringing spiritual and physical sight (John 9:5).

questions.question: How does John 9 encourage believers to respond to spiritual opposition and rejection?
options: Maintain faith and continue to testify about God’s work.
Deny the truth to avoid conflict.
questions.correctAnswer: Maintain faith and continue to testify about God’s work.
questions.explanation: Despite being cast out by the Pharisees, the healed man remains faithful and testifies about Jesus, showing perseverance in faith (John 9:34-35).

questions.question: What does John 9 teach about the nature of God’s work in the world?
options: God’s work is only for the elite.
God’s work is revealed through acts of mercy and miracles.
God’s work is secret and never witnessed.
God’s work depends on human strength alone.
questions.correctAnswer: God’s work is revealed through acts of mercy and miracles.
questions.explanation: Jesus healed the blind man to make the works of God manifest, demonstrating God’s power and mercy (John 9:3, 9:33).

questions.question: Based on John 9, how does the healed man show integrity and honesty in his testimony?
options: He makes up details to impress the Pharisees.
He refuses to answer any questions.
He honestly admits what he knows and what he doesn’t know.
He blames others for his blindness.
questions.correctAnswer: He honestly admits what he knows and what he doesn’t know.
questions.explanation: The man openly states he does not know if Jesus is a sinner but knows he was blind and now sees (John 9:25), showing integrity in his witness.

questions.question: How does John 9 teach about the importance of spiritual discernment within the church community?
options: Discern truth by observing God’s works and hearing God’s servants.
questions.correctAnswer: Discern truth by observing God’s works and hearing God’s servants.
questions.explanation: The healed man argues that God does not hear sinners but hears those who do His will, encouraging discernment based on God’s work (John 9:31-33).

hard.title: John Chapter 9 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from John Chapter 9.

questions.question: In John 9:3, Jesus says the man was born blind so that the works of God might be ________.
questions.correctAnswer: manifested
questions.explanation: John 9:3 states that the man was born blind not because of sin, but so that the works of God should be made manifest in him.

questions.question: What method did Jesus use to heal the blind man according to John 9:6?
options: He spat on the ground and made clay of the spittle
He touched the man's eyes directly
He spoke a word of healing
questions.correctAnswer: He spat on the ground and made clay of the spittle
questions.explanation: John 9:6 describes Jesus spitting on the ground, making clay from the spittle, and anointing the man's eyes with it before instructing him to wash in the pool of Siloam.

questions.question: What does the name 'Siloam' mean as explained in John 9:7?
questions.correctAnswer: Sent
questions.explanation: John 9:7 clarifies that 'Siloam' means 'Sent', highlighting a possible typological connection to Jesus who is sent by the Father.

questions.question: The healing of the blind man took place on which day, according to John 9:14?
options: The first day of the week
questions.correctAnswer: The Sabbath
questions.explanation: John 9:14 explicitly states that Jesus made the clay and opened the man's eyes on the Sabbath, which is significant for the ensuing controversy.

questions.question: How did some Pharisees react to Jesus healing on the Sabbath as described in John 9:16?
options: Some said He is not of God because He broke the Sabbath
They all unanimously accepted Jesus as God
They praised Jesus for His healing
questions.correctAnswer: Some said He is not of God because He broke the Sabbath
questions.explanation: John 9:16 shows a division among the Pharisees, with some rejecting Jesus because He did not observe the Sabbath law, while others questioned how a sinner could perform miracles.

questions.question: In John 9:17, the healed blind man calls Jesus a ________.
questions.correctAnswer: prophet
questions.explanation: John 9:17 records the blind man’s response to the Pharisees, recognizing Jesus as a prophet, which connects typologically with Old Testament prophetic figures.

questions.question: What was the reason the blind man’s parents gave for not explaining how their son received sight in John 9:22?
options: They believed it was a miracle
questions.correctAnswer: They feared the Jews
questions.explanation: John 9:22 explains the parents’ reluctance was due to fear of the Jews, who had agreed to exclude anyone confessing Christ from the synagogue.

questions.question: How did the healed man respond when asked to give God the praise in John 9:24?
options: He said, 'Whether he be a sinner or no, I know that I was blind and now I see'
questions.correctAnswer: He said, 'Whether he be a sinner or no, I know that I was blind and now I see'
questions.explanation: John 9:25 quotes the man affirming his personal experience of healing, irrespective of Jesus’ sinfulness, emphasizing faith based on encounter rather than doctrinal dispute.

questions.question: Which Old Testament figure do the Pharisees claim to be disciples of, according to John 9:28?
questions.correctAnswer: Moses
questions.explanation: John 9:28 shows the Pharisees asserting their allegiance to Moses, contrasting their skepticism of Jesus’ origins.

questions.question: What argument does the healed man give in John 9:31 to prove Jesus is from God?
options: God hears not sinners but those who worship and do His will
He saw Jesus with his own eyes
He was told by his parents
questions.correctAnswer: God hears not sinners but those who worship and do His will
questions.explanation: John 9:31 emphasizes a theological point that God responds to those who worship Him and obey His will, implying Jesus’ works are divine.

questions.question: According to John 9:32, what was unprecedented about Jesus healing the man born blind?
options: No one had ever opened the eyes of a man born blind before
It was not a miracle but a trick
questions.correctAnswer: No one had ever opened the eyes of a man born blind before
questions.explanation: John 9:32 highlights the uniqueness of Jesus’ miracle, underscoring its divine and authoritative nature.

questions.question: What is the theological significance of Jesus declaring Himself "the light of the world" in John 9:5?
options: It signifies Jesus as the spiritual illuminator in a world of darkness
It refers to a literal light source
It is a metaphor for physical healing only
It indicates Jesus' role as a political leader
questions.correctAnswer: It signifies Jesus as the spiritual illuminator in a world of darkness
questions.explanation: John 9:5 uses light metaphorically to describe Jesus’ role in bringing spiritual enlightenment, a theme consistent with Old Testament imagery like Isaiah 9:2 and Psalm 27:1.

questions.question: True or False: According to John 9:41, Jesus taught that those who claim to see but are spiritually blind have no sin.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: John 9:41 says that if they were blind, they would have no sin; but since they claim to see, their sin remains, indicating spiritual blindness carries guilt.

questions.question: How does the dialogue between Jesus and the Pharisees in John 9 function as a literary device?
options: It serves as a chiasm highlighting spiritual blindness and sight
It is a simple narrative without deeper meaning
It is an example of parabolic teaching
questions.correctAnswer: It serves as a chiasm highlighting spiritual blindness and sight
questions.explanation: The narrative contrasts physical and spiritual sight and blindness, a typical Johannine chiastic structure emphasizing irony and judgment (John 9:39-41).

questions.question: Which Old Testament theme does the man’s healing in John 9 most closely parallel?
options: The Exodus leading the blind out of darkness
The creation of light in Genesis
The healing miracles of Elijah and Elisha
The rebuilding of the temple in Ezra
questions.correctAnswer: The healing miracles of Elijah and Elisha
questions.explanation: The healing of the blind man resonates with prophetic miracles in Kings, where God’s power restores sight and life, affirming Jesus as a prophet (John 9:17).

theological.title: John Chapter 9 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from John Chapter 9 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What reason does Jesus give for the man being born blind?
options: To manifest the works of God
To test the faith of the disciples
questions.correctAnswer: To manifest the works of God
questions.explanation: Jesus clarifies that neither the man nor his parents sinned, but that the man was born blind so that the works of God might be revealed in him (John 9:3). This aligns with God's sovereign purpose in allowing suffering for His glory, consistent with Job 1:21, Romans 8:28, Isaiah 64:8, and 2 Corinthians 12:9.

questions.question: How does Jesus describe His role while He is in the world?
options: I am the light of the world
I am the bread of life
I am the way, the truth, and the life
questions.correctAnswer: I am the light of the world
questions.explanation: Jesus declares He is the light of the world during His earthly ministry (John 9:5), revealing divine truth and dispelling spiritual darkness. This echoes themes from Isaiah 9:2, Psalm 27:1, 2 Corinthians 4:6, and Revelation 21:23.

questions.question: What method did Jesus use to heal the man's blindness?
options: He made clay with spittle and anointed the man's eyes
He touched the man's eyes directly
He spoke a word of healing
He laid hands on the man's head
questions.correctAnswer: He made clay with spittle and anointed the man's eyes
questions.explanation: Jesus spat on the ground, made clay with the saliva, anointed the man’s eyes, and told him to wash in the pool of Siloam to receive sight (John 9:6-7). This physical act signifies the incarnational nature of Christ’s healing ministry, similar to Old Testament signs like Elisha's healing of Naaman (2 Kings 5:10) and prophetic symbolic acts (Ezekiel 4:1).

questions.question: What is the significance of the pool of Siloam in the healing narrative?
options: It means 'Sent', symbolizing Jesus as the sent one
It was the only pool in Jerusalem
It was a place of ritual cleansing for sin
It was a healing spring with medicinal properties
questions.correctAnswer: It means 'Sent', symbolizing Jesus as the sent one
questions.explanation: The pool's name means 'Sent', pointing to Jesus as the one sent by the Father to bring healing and salvation (John 9:7). This reflects the messianic mission outlined in Isaiah 61:1, John 3:17, Luke 4:18, and Hebrews 10:5.

questions.question: How did the neighbors respond to the man's healing?
options: Some recognized him as the blind beggar; others said he only looked like him
They rejected the healing as a trick
They reported the healing to the priests
questions.correctAnswer: Some recognized him as the blind beggar; others said he only looked like him
questions.explanation: The neighbors debated whether the healed man was the same person who had been blind (John 9:8-9). This highlights the reality of human skepticism and the challenge of recognizing divine intervention, consistent with reactions to miracles in Exodus 4:1, Numbers 13:33, Mark 6:2, and Acts 3:12.

questions.question: What was the reaction of the Pharisees to the healing?
options: They were divided, some saying Jesus was not from God because He healed on the Sabbath, others wondered how a sinner could perform such miracles
They glorified God for the miracle
They immediately believed Jesus was the Messiah
questions.correctAnswer: They were divided, some saying Jesus was not from God because He healed on the Sabbath, others wondered how a sinner could perform such miracles
questions.explanation: The Pharisees debated Jesus' authority and divine origin because He healed on the Sabbath (John 9:16). This division illustrates the tension between legalism and recognition of God's work, paralleling conflicts in Numbers 15:32-36, Matthew 12:1-14, Luke 13:14-17, and Hebrews 4:9-10.

questions.question: How did the man born blind describe Jesus when asked about Him by the Pharisees?
options: He said Jesus was a prophet
He said Jesus was just a teacher
questions.correctAnswer: He said Jesus was a prophet
questions.explanation: The healed man acknowledged Jesus as a prophet (John 9:17), recognizing His divine authority and messianic role, consistent with Old Testament prophetic expectations (Deuteronomy 18:15, Isaiah 9:6, Malachi 3:1, Luke 7:16).

questions.question: Why were the parents of the healed man hesitant to speak openly about Jesus?
options: They feared the Jews who had agreed to expel anyone confessing Christ
They did not believe their son was healed
They were ashamed of their son's former blindness
They wanted to protect Jesus from persecution
questions.correctAnswer: They feared the Jews who had agreed to expel anyone confessing Christ
questions.explanation: The parents feared the Jewish authorities because of the threat of excommunication from the synagogue for confessing Jesus as Christ (John 9:22). This reflects early opposition to Jesus' ministry seen in Acts 4:1-21, John 12:42, Exodus 23:2, and Matthew 10:16-23.

questions.question: What was the healed man's response when told to give God the praise and call Jesus a sinner?
options: He said he only knew that he was blind but now he sees
He agreed that Jesus was a sinner
questions.correctAnswer: He said he only knew that he was blind but now he sees
questions.explanation: The man focused on the undeniable fact of his healing rather than theological speculation about Jesus' sinfulness (John 9:25). This testimony underscores faith grounded in experience, consistent with Psalm 34:8, Isaiah 35:5, Jeremiah 31:34, and Acts 4:20.

questions.question: How did the healed man respond to the Pharisees' repeated questioning about Jesus' healing method?
options: He expressed frustration and questioned why they would listen again, asking if they wanted to become Jesus' disciples
questions.correctAnswer: He expressed frustration and questioned why they would listen again, asking if they wanted to become Jesus' disciples
questions.explanation: The man's response (John 9:27) shows his conviction and the Pharisees' unwillingness to accept the truth, illustrating the hardness of heart seen in Scripture (Isaiah 6:10, John 12:40, Hebrews 3:7-8, Romans 1:18-21).

questions.question: What argument did the healed man use to affirm Jesus' divine authority despite the Pharisees' rejection?
options: He pointed out the miracle of opening eyes from birth blindness as unprecedented
He cited Old Testament prophecies directly
He claimed to be a prophet himself
questions.correctAnswer: He pointed out the miracle of opening eyes from birth blindness as unprecedented
questions.explanation: The man emphasized that no one had ever healed a congenital blindness before (John 9:30-32), asserting that such power must come from God, consistent with God's unique ability to perform miracles in Exodus 14:21-22, Psalm 146:8, Isaiah 42:7, and Matthew 11:4-5.

questions.question: What does the healed man say about God hearing sinners versus those who worship God and do His will?
options: God does not hear sinners but hears those who worship Him and do His will
questions.correctAnswer: God does not hear sinners but hears those who worship Him and do His will
questions.explanation: The man states a principle that God listens to those who are obedient and worship Him genuinely (John 9:31), aligned with teachings in Psalm 66:18, Proverbs 15:29, Isaiah 59:2, and 1 John 3:22 about God's responsive nature to righteousness.

questions.question: How did the Jewish leaders respond to the man's testimony about Jesus?
options: They accused him of being born in sin and cast him out
They accepted his testimony and believed in Jesus
questions.correctAnswer: They accused him of being born in sin and cast him out
questions.explanation: The leaders rejected the man's witness, accusing him of sinfulness and expelling him (John 9:34), illustrating spiritual blindness and opposition to God's work, as seen in Isaiah 6:9-10, Matthew 23:13, John 12:37-40, and Revelation 3:16.

questions.question: What question does Jesus ask the man after He finds out he was cast out?
options: Dost thou believe on the Son of God?
Do you want to be healed again?
Who told you to follow me?
Are you angry with the Pharisees?
questions.correctAnswer: Dost thou believe on the Son of God?
questions.explanation: Jesus directly asks the man if he believes in the Son of God (John 9:35), connecting physical healing with spiritual salvation, consistent with John 3:16, John 6:40, Romans 10:9, and Hebrews 11:6.

questions.question: How does the healed man respond to Jesus' question about belief in the Son of God?
options: He asks, 'Who is he, Lord, that I might believe on him?'
questions.correctAnswer: He asks, 'Who is he, Lord, that I might believe on him?'
questions.explanation: The man shows humility and desire for understanding before faith (John 9:36), reflecting the biblical pattern of seeking knowledge leading to faith, as seen in Acts 8:30-31, John 20:24-29, Psalm 34:8, and Proverbs 2:3-6.
